metadata.title: CVE-2021-0920 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In unix_scm_to_skb of af_unix.c, there is a possible use after free bug dueto a race condition. This could lead to local escalation of privilege withSystem execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed forexploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID:A-196926917References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-0920` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-223-generic - 4.4.0-223.256~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-223-generic - 4.4.0-223.256~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-223-lowlatency - 4.4.0-223.256~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1103-aws - 4.4.0-1103.108
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1124-azure - 4.15.0-1124.137~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-223.256~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1103.108').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1124.137~14.04.1').
